item.title: Mozilla releases Firefox 139.0.1 update to fix artifacts on Nvidia GPUs
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Mozilla has rolled out an emergency Firefox 139.0.1 update after the Tuesday release caused graphical artifacts on PCs with NVIDIA GPUs. [...]

item.title: Microsoft Authenticator now warns to export passwords before July cutoff
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: The Microsoft Authenticator app is now issuing notifications warning that the password autofill feature is being deprecated in July, suggesting users move to Microsoft Edge instead. [...]

item.title: ConnectWise breached in cyberattack linked to nation-state hackers
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: IT management software firm ConnectWise says a suspected state-sponsored cyberattack breached its environment and impacted a limited number of ScreenConnect customers. [...]

item.title: Threat actors abuse Google Apps Script in evasive phishing attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Threat actors are abusing the trusted Google platform 'Google Apps Script' to host phishing pages, making them appear legitimate and eliminating the risk of them getting flagged by security tools. [...]

item.title: Apple Safari exposes users to fullscreen browser-in-the-middle attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A weakness in Apple's Safari web browser allows threat actors to leverage the fullscreen browser-in-the-middle (BitM) technique to steal account credentials from unsuspecting users. [...]

item.title: US sanctions firm linked to cyber scams behind $200 million in losses
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The U.S. Treasury Department has sanctioned Funnull Technology, a Philippines-based company that supports hundreds of thousands of malicious websites behind cyber scams linked to over $200 million in losses for Americans. [...]

item.title: Cybercriminals exploit AI hype to spread ransomware, malware
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Threat actors linked to lesser-known ransomware and malware projects now use AI tools as lures to infect unsuspecting victims with malicious payloads. [...]

item.title: Attackers are mapping your attack surface—are you?
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by Sprocket Security
item.description: Attackers are mapping your infrastructure before you even realize what's exposed. Sprocket ASM flips the script — giving you the same recon capabilities they use, plus change detection and actionable insights to close gaps fast. See your attack surface the way hackers do and beat them to it. [...]

item.title: Victoria’s Secret takes down website after security incident
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Victoria's Secret, the fashion giant, has taken down its website and some store services because of an ongoing security incident [...]

item.title: Microsoft: Windows 11 might fail to start after installing KB5058405
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has confirmed that some Windows 11 systems might fail to start after installing the KB5058405 security update released during this month's Patch Tuesday. [...]

item.title: Data broker LexisNexis discloses data breach affecting 364,000 people
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Data broker giant LexisNexis Risk Solutions has revealed that unknown attackers stole the personal information of over 364,000 individuals in a December breach. [...]

item.title: Windows 10 KB5058481 update brings seconds back to calendar flyout
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Microsoft has released the optional KB5058481 preview cumulative update for Windows 10 22H2 with seven changes, including restoring seconds to the time display in the calendar flyout for those who previously lost it. [...]

item.title: Windows 11 KB5058499 update rolls out new Share and Click to Do features
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: ​​Microsoft has released the KB5058499 preview cumulative update for Windows 11 24H2 with forty-eight new features or changes, with many gradually rolling out, such as the new Windows Share feature and tje Click to Do Preview. [...]
